channel.title: Hosting on linux complications
channel.description:
Hey all,
I have just set everything up on a [b]Linux [/b]system, Gnome based (Fedora 12), It is all set up and ready but when I use the run.sh I have created it states the following:
[code] Server Online At Port: 43594 [b]config\objects.cfg: file not found.[/b] [/code]
The console outputs the following:
[code] ClientHandler: Accepted from ********:52927 Client type: low memory version UserId: 0 Owner_kiz is signing onto server. Owner_kiz: character file not found. LOADED: -1 [b]Could not save for Owner_kiz[/b] ClientHandler: Client Owner_kiz disconnected. [/code]
It will not load existing characters either it just treats every connection as new. I didn't know what else I could put, So if you need any more information please ask :). Any help would be appreciated.
Thanks
Kiz
Edit:
My run.sh Contain the following:
[code] #!/bin/bash /home/Kieron/Desktop/jdk1.6.0_18/bin/java -Xmx512m server [/code]
[b]Screen Print:[/b]
http://www.glowfoto.com/viewimage.php?img=28-145657L&rand=9056&t=png&m=03&y=2010&srv=img6
[b][u]Resolved! Seems Linux is case sensitive where as windows isn't, Just changed the folder names to how they appear in the client.java and it is all working fine now[/b][/u]
[i][b][u]MOD PLEASE LOCK[/u][/b][/i]

item.title: Hosting on linux complications
item.dc:creator: @Kizbits2000 Kizbits2000
item.description:
@Kizbits2000 wrote:

Hey all,

I have just set everything up on a Linux system, Gnome based (Fedora 12), It is all set up and ready but when I use the run.sh I have created it states the following:

Server Online At Port: 43594
[b]config\objects.cfg: file not found.[/b]

The console outputs the following:

ClientHandler: Accepted from ********:52927
Client type: low memory version
UserId: 0
Owner_kiz is signing onto server.
Owner_kiz: character file not found.
LOADED: -1
[b]Could not save for Owner_kiz[/b]
ClientHandler: Client Owner_kiz disconnected.

It will not load existing characters either it just treats every connection as new. I didn’t know what else I could put, So if you need any more information please ask :).
Any help would be appreciated.

Thanks

Kiz

Edit:

My run.sh Contain the following:

#!/bin/bash
/home/Kieron/Desktop/jdk1.6.0_18/bin/java -Xmx512m server

Screen Print:

http://www.glowfoto.com/viewimage.php?img=28-145657L&rand=9056&t=png&m=03&y=2010&srv=img6

[u]Resolved! Seems Linux is case sensitive where as windows isn’t, Just changed the folder names to how they appear in the client.java and it is all working fine now[/u]

MOD PLEASE LOCK

Read full topic
